intro: Anomanthodia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anomanthodia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
